t: Psalm 55
Cast Your Burden on the Lord
To the choirmaster: with stringed instruments. A Maskil of David.
Give*pn ear to my prayer, O God, and*ld hide not yourself from my plea for mercy!
Attend*ln to me, and answer me; I*ld am restless in my complaint and I moan,
because*ln of the noise of the enemy, because*ld of the oppression of the wicked. For*ln they drop trouble upon me, and*ld in anger they bear a grudge against me.
My*pn heart is in anguish within me; the*ld terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Fear*ln and trembling come upon me, and*ld horror overwhelms me.
And*ln I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I*ld would fly away and be at rest;
yes,*ln I would wander far away; I*ld would lodge in the wilderness; Selah*ig
I*ln would hurry to find a shelter from*ld the raging wind and tempest.”
Destroy,*pn O Lord, divide their tongues; for*ld I see violence and strife in the city.
Day*ln and night they go around it on*ld its walls, and*ln iniquity and trouble are within it;
ruin*ld is in its midst; oppression*ln and fraud do*ld not depart from its marketplace.
For*pn it is not an enemy who taunts me— then*ld I could bear it; it*ln is not an adversary who deals insolently with me— then*ld I could hide from him.
But*ln it is you, a man, my equal, my*ld companion, my familiar friend.
We*ln used to take sweet counsel together; within*ld God’s house we walked in the throng.
Let*ln death steal over them; let*ld them go down to Sheol alive; for*ld evil is in their dwelling place and in their heart.
But*pn I call to God, and*ld the Lord*s will save me.
Evening*ln and morning and at noon I*ld utter my complaint and moan, and*ld he hears my voice.
He*ln redeems my soul in safety from*ld the battle that I wage, for*ld many are arrayed against me.
God*ln will give ear and humble them, he*ld who is enthroned from of old, Selah*ig because*ln they do not change and*ld do not fear God.
My*pn companion stretched out his hand against his friends; he*ld violated his covenant.
His*ln speech was smooth as butter, yet*ld war was in his heart; his*ln words were softer than oil, yet*ld they were drawn swords.
Cast*pn your burden on the Lord,*s and*ld he will sustain you; he*ln will never permit the*ld righteous to be moved.
But*pn you, O God, will cast them down into*ld the pit of destruction; men*ln of blood and treachery shall*ld not live out half their days. But*ln I will trust in you.
